definition: to resist/imperial/(classical) to drive (a chariot)/to manage/to govern

sentences.english: Has stimulated the Queen bloating pain, physician without surgery.
sentences.chinese: 又逢皇后腹脹疼痛，御醫無術。

sentences.english: The Emperor immediately sprang out of bed, and caused his body physician to be called;
sentences.chinese: 皇帝立即跳下牀，命令把他的御醫召進來。

sentences.english: I have called for a healer.
He asked us to bring the doctor here, to check his sickness.
sentences.chinese: 叫我連御醫也帶來了，我們去給他看病吧。

sentences.english: The kings son was well, and they named the maiden physician to the court.
sentences.chinese: 國王的兒子能開口說話了，姑娘被任命爲宮廷御醫。

definition: Hundred Days Reform (1898), failed attempt to reform the Qing dynasty
to die of old age/to die in one's bed at a ripe old age
to enter the emperor's palace/(slang) to go to jail
to comment/a point by point commentary
to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
place at the imperial court, where emperor handled government affairs, gave orders etc
